text: U-Bahn station Magdalenenstraße before its 2003 renovation The station after renovation Magdalenenstraße is a Berlin U-Bahn station located on the line. The station was designed by the Swedish architect Alfred Grenander and it was opened for service in 1930. It was closed for a few months in 1945 and was renovated in 2004–05. The walls are covered with green panels and the columns are also painted green. The artworks of East German artist are displayed on the walls. They are painted in a very abstract way and show events in German history. In 1995 these paintings were to have been covered by advertisements, but this was prevented by the culture department of the Berliner Senat.J.
